Do you have annotation rollovers enabled?

This code hasn't changed for a while.

I found a whole in the implementation: we collect the markers (getMarkers() and
store them, however when we run the action the model might have changed
in-between (e.g. due to reconciling) and when we then select a marker from the
previously stored list we only consider markers that still have a marker
annotation in the model. If none of the markers in the list has a marker
annotation, null is returned which leads to the reported NPE.

Fixed (added null-check and updated Javadoc).

I'm glad you found it, because I don't know which pref to check for annotation
hovers ;-)

Try Java > Editor > Hovers
  [x] Enable annotation roll-over when opening a new editor

No, that was not checked.

What does this setting do?

If you have multiple annotations at the same location in the vertical ruler then
they will expand if this feature is enabled.

Ah, OK.  For some reason I interpreted it as something that happens while an
editor is being opened.
Does this work similarly to the "Enable folding" setting?  I find this to be
clear, without having the "when opening a new editor" suffix.

Can the setting be toggled on a per-editor basis after the editor is opened?  
If not, I would suggest just making it a global setting, rather than introducing
a temporal mode.

I'd also suggest clarifying the description, e.g. "Expand multiple annotations
on same line on hover" or "Hover expands multiple annotations on same line".
